guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for carbamazepine and HLA-A

relatedGenes.name: major histocompatibility complex, class I, A

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299111

text.html:
• Carefully weigh the risk of DRESS and SJS/TEN against the benefits

  • If an alternative is an option, choose an alternative

implications: Patients with this genetic variation have an increased risk of experiencing the life-threatening cutaneous adverse events DRESS and Stevens-Johnson syndrome/toxic epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN). The risk of carbamazepine-induced DRESS in these patients is 0.89%.
